Hi Dr. Goodwin,

I am a graduate student at the University of Minnesota, working with Dr.
Girshick, and we are interested in using Cantera to work with our complex
silane plasma chemistry mechanism.  I have attempted to install version 1.4
for Unix, and so far I have not gotten through the "make install" step.  I
have spent some time following the paths of compilation, and I believe I'm
making progress, but I thought you might have a simple suggestion of how to
get Cantera up and running.  The problem seems to be that the necessary
files are not present in the correct directories, or the correct compiler is
not being used - I'm not entirely sure, but trying to compile each small
file individually does not seem efficient.  I appreciate any advice you can
give, but I will keep working on it as is.  Also, I just wanted to let you
know that we are very excited to work with Cantera.

Thanks,

Sarah Warthesen



-----Original Message-----
From: dggoodwin [mailto:dgoodwin@...]
Sent: Friday, February 15, 2002 11:00 AM
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [cantera] progress report



Sometimes I wonder what I've gotten myself into with Cantera... it
turns out (big surprise) that developing a large software project is
A Big Job. Particularly when one has a day job...

Anyway, significant progress is being made, although it may not seem
like it (to anyone but me). In particular, the first really-useful
Cantera application is almost ready - a one dimensional reacting-flow
application, that can be used to simulate:

- 1D laminar flames
- counterflow flames
- stagnation-point flows with surface chemistry (CVD, catalysis, etc.)

I expect it will be ready to ship in a couple of weeks... stay tuned.
